history.proof: unfold enumerable__T. hauto lq: on depth: 3.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
enumerable__T nat

Premises:
enumerable__T = fun X : Type => exists f : nat -> option X, forall x : X, exists n : nat, f n = Some x : Type -> Prop Arguments enumerable__T _%type_scope
enumerable_enumerable_T : forall X : Type, enumerable (fun _ : X => True) < -> enumerable__T X
count_bool = ex_intro (fun f : nat -> option bool => forall x : bool, exists n : nat, f n = Some x) (fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => Some true | S _ => Some false end) (fun x : bool => if x as b return (exists n : nat, match n with | 0 => Some true | S _ => Some false end = Some b) then ex_intro (fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => Some true | S _ => Some false end = Some true) 0 eq_refl else ex_intro (fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => Some true | S _ => Some false end = Some false) 1 eq_refl) : enumerable__T bool
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Nat.lnot = fun a n : nat => Nat.lxor a (Nat.ones n) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.lnot (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.land = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise andb a a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.land (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.lxor = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise xorb (Init.Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.lxor (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.lor = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise orb (Init.Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.lor (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.sqrt = fun n : nat => Init.Nat.sqrt_iter n 0 0 0 : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sqrt _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.log2 = fun n : nat => Init.Nat.log2_iter (Init.Nat.pred n) 0 1 0 : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.log2 _%nat_scope
gt = fun n m : nat => m < n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gt (_ _)%nat_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.Bezout = fun n m p : nat => exists a b : nat, a * n = p + b * m : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Bezout (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pred _%nat_scope
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.pow = fix pow (n m : nat) {struct m} : nat := match m with | 0 => 1 | S m0 => n * pow n m0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pow (_ _)%nat_scope
FinFun.Fin2Restrict.extend : forall n : nat, (Fin.t n -> Fin.t n) -> nat -> nat
Nat.log2_up = fun a : nat => match 1 ?= a with | Lt => S (Nat.log2 (Nat.pred a)) | _ => 0 end : nat -> nat Arguments Nat.log2_up _%nat_scope
Nat.sqrt_up = fun a : nat => match 0 ?= a with | Lt => S (Nat.sqrt (Nat.pred a)) | _ => 0 end : nat -> nat Arguments Nat.sqrt_up _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.odd = fun n : nat => negb (Init.Nat.even n) : nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.odd _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.div2 = fix div2 (n : nat) : nat := match n with | S (S n') => S (div2 n') | _ => 0 end : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div2 _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.min = fix min (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S n' => match m with | 0 => 0 | S m' => S (min n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.min (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.max = fix max (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S n' => match m with | 0 => n | S m' => S (max n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.max (_ _)%nat_scope
BinNatDef.N.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.N0 | S n' => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n') end : nat -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.of_nat _%nat_scope
length : forall A : Type, list A -> nat
BinPosDef.Pos.testbit_nat = fix testbit_nat (p : BinNums.positive) : nat -> bool := match p with | BinNums.xI p0 => fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => true | S n' => testbit_nat p0 n' end | BinNums.xO p0 => fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => false | S n' => testbit_nat p0 n' end | BinNums.xH => fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => true | S _ => false end end : BinNums.positive -> nat -> bool Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.testbit_nat _%positive_scope _%nat_scope
Fin.to_nat = fix to_nat (m : nat) (n : Fin.t m) {struct n} : {i : nat | i < m} := match n in (Fin.t n0) return {i : nat | i < n0} with | @Fin.F1 j => exist (fun i : nat => i < S j) 0 (Nat.lt_0_succ j) | @Fin.FS n0 p => let (i, P) := to_nat n0 p in exist (fun i0 : nat => i0 < S n0) (S i) (lt_n_S i n0 P) end : forall m : nat, Fin.t m -> {i : nat | i < m} Arguments Fin.to_nat {m}%nat_scope
FinFun.bFun = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x : nat, x < n -> f x < n : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bFun _%nat_scope _%function_scope
BinNatDef.N.testbit_nat = fun a : BinNums.N => match a with | BinNums.N0 => fun _ : nat => false | BinNums.Npos p => BinPos.Pos.testbit_nat p end : BinNums.N -> nat -> bool Arguments BinNatDef.N.testbit_nat _%N_scope _%nat_scope
nth : forall A : Type, list A -> nat -> option A
List.nth : forall A : Type, nat -> list A -> A -> A
Init.Nat.testbit = fix testbit (a n : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => Init.Nat.odd a | S n0 => testbit (Init.Nat.div2 a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.testbit (_ _)%nat_scope
bet_emp : forall (P : nat -> Prop) (k : nat), between P k k
FinFun.bSurjective = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall y : nat, y < n -> exists x : nat, x < n /\ f x = y : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bSurjective _%nat_scope _%function_scope
FinFun.bInjective = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x y : nat, x < n -> y < n -> f x = f y -> x = y : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bInjective _%nat_scope _%function_scope
between_ind : forall (P : nat -> Prop) (k : nat) (P0 : nat -> Prop), P0 k -> (forall l : nat, between P k l -> P0 l -> P l -> P0 (S l)) -> forall n : nat, between P k n -> P0 n

Qed.```
